channel.title: Movies - Digg
channel.description: Movies on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Here's What Hogwarts Fashion Would Look Like In Every Era From The 1920s To 2020s
item.description: We petition this to be the official costumes of the Harry Potter movies.
item.kicker: HARRY POTTER AND THE DASHING HALLOWS

item.title: It's Actually A Great Time To Try To Sell A TV Show
item.description: How Hollywood is adapting to the pandemic.
item.kicker: TIME TO OPEN UP THE DRAFT FOLDER

item.title: What Would Have Happened To Wilson After 'Cast Away'?
item.description: An oceanographer, a marine biologist, a ship captain and the former CEO of FedEx weigh in.

item.title: We're All Living In 'The Lighthouse'
item.description: Signs that life in isolation is like Robert Eggers's 2019 horror movie "The Lighthouse," now streaming on Amazon Prime.
item.kicker: THEY GAVE US ALL THE CLUES

item.title: The Unbelievable Way Tom Cruise's HALO Jump Was Filmed For 'Mission Impossible: Fallout'
item.description: This fascinating side-by-side clip shows that the real stunt hero of the scene wasn't Cruise, but rather the camera man who jumped off the plane backwards and filmed Cruise with a camera on his head the whole way down.

item.title: The Writer Of 'Demolition Man' On The Predictive Power Of His 1993 Movie
item.description: In this interview with "Demolition Man" writer Daniel Waters, he discusses the accidental coronavirus-era prescience of his 1993 action comedy starring Sylvester Stallone, Sandra Bullock and Wesley Snipes, from no-contact high fives to seashells.

item.title: How Morley Became The Cigarette Brand Of Choice For Hollywood
item.description: If you pay close attention to TV and movies, you'll begin to recognize a recurring cigarette brand.

item.title: Hollywood Is All But Writing Off 2020. What Does That Mean For The Future Of Movies?
item.description: The studio executives and talent agents responsible for keeping the business part of showbiz beating ever forward against the tide have referred to the worldwide pandemic as "nuclear winter." "Doomsday," even.

item.title: Here's The First Clip From 'Stardust,' The David Bowie Biopic Starring Johnny Flynn And Marc Maron
item.description: A theatrical date hasn't been announced, but keep an eye out for a release this year.

item.title: The Way This Indie Filmmaker Uses Motion Tracking To Transform A Tiny Green Screen Set Into A Massive Digital World Is Mind-Blowing
item.description: When you don't have the money to build lavish sets, that's when creativity comes in.

item.title: 'Cats' Is Even More Bonkers When You Watch It With The Audio Description Track On Blu-Ray
item.description: Whoever had to do this job, explaining what was happening on screen visually for the "Cats" movie, we salute you and we hope you're okay.

item.title: Tax Incentives And The Human Imagination
item.description: It would be interesting to look at locations of the American popular imagination, as seen in movies and TV, mapped against regional tax breaks for the film industry.

item.title: Twenty Years Later, 'American Psycho' Has Only Grown More Timely
item.description: Patrick Bateman's search for identity in Mary Harron's 2000 film is a story that's inched closer and closer to our modern existence.

item.title: The Medical Advisors For The Movie 'Contagion' Saw A Pandemic Coming, But Got One Big Thing Wrong
item.description: CNBC tracked down some of the film's scientific advisors to ask about its scientific rigor and how they're thinking about it today.

item.title: Watch Old Hollywood Stars Swear — A Lot — In Hilarious Bloopers From Classic Films
item.description: We tend to think of old Hollywood stars as elegant and glamorized and refined — but turns out many had quite a potty mouth.

item.title: Watch Old Hollywood Stars Swear — A Lot — In Hilarious Bloopers From Classic Films
item.description: We tend to think of old Hollywood stars as elegant and glamorized and refined — but turns out many had quite a potty mouth.

item.title: The Honest Trailer For 'Cats' Reminds Us How Truly Deranged The Movie Was
item.description: Once upon a time in 2019, there was this really batsh*t crazy movie called "Cats" — remember that?

item.title: An Examination Of Christian Bale's 12 Best Roles
item.description: Looking at the actor's most important performances, 20 years on from his breakout in "American Psycho."

item.title: Confessions Of An Obsolete Child Actor
item.description: Being cast in "School of Rock" was a defining moment in my life — for better or worse.

item.title: Behold 'Dune': An Exclusive Look At Photos Of Denis Villeneuve's Sci-Fi Epic
item.description: Feuding royals. A deadly planet. Before "Star Wars" or "Game of Thrones," there was Frank Herbert's legendary sci-fi novel.

item.title: 'Never Rarely Sometimes Always': A Human Tale Of Reproductive Rights
item.description: Eliza Hittman's film explores how an alienated young person in difficult circumstances is kept from articulating her needs and desires by her naïveté and the cruel diktats of the world around her.

item.title: Disney+ Found A Truly Bizarre Way To Edit A Bare Butt Out Of 1984 Tom Hanks Movie 'Splash'
item.description: Turns out, we've gotten… more culturally conservative since 1984.

item.title: Bob Iger Thought He Was Leaving On Top. Now, He's Fighting For Disney's Life
item.description: The former CEO thought he was riding into the sunset. Now he's reasserting control and reimagining Disney as a company with fewer employees and more thermometers.

item.title: 'Back To The Future' Fans Recreated The Sequel Scene-For-Scene While Under Quarantine And The Result Is An Epic Hodgepodge
item.description: The 88 Project brought together 300 people from 9 different countries filming 88 scenes from "Back to the Future Part II."

item.title: Unexpected Movie Masterpieces To Watch In Quarantine
item.description: Some were blasted by critics, some flopped at the box office and all are ripe to attain cult-classic status.

item.title: David Lynch Is Making Tiny Lamps In Quarantine
item.description: The Los Angeles-based filmmaker is also doing a lot of meditating — to open up "the tube through which ideas flow."

item.title: The 'Parasite' Exit Survey
item.description: With the Best Picture-winning film hitting Hulu on Wednesday, the Ringer staff took a trip back to the Park family's modern, foreboding mansion.

item.title: Filmmaker Reacts To The Incredibly Realistic Scenes In Movies That Are Actually Special Effects
item.description: Peter McKinnon is continually shocked by the extremely real looking fake scenes in modern Hollywood features.
item.kicker: EVEN BETTER THAN THE REAL THING

item.title: How 'A Goofy Movie' Became Disney's Most Unlikely Sleeper Hit
item.description: The 1995 animated musical's cast and crew on how their scrappy little production — "It wasn't even a B movie. It was a C movie" — beat the odds to become a beloved cult favorite.

item.title: The Lost And The Furious: Films That Tried (And Failed) To Ride The 'Fast & Furious' Wave
item.description: Naturally, the success of the Fast and Furious films has spawned a number cheap rip-offs and these are the worst offenders.

item.title: The Streaming Guide: 10 'Twin Peaks' Descendants To Watch
item.description: Thirty years ago on Wednesday, the boldest, wildest show to ever hit prime-time TV premiered. Since then, neither television nor movies have been the same.

item.title: A Top Hollywood Camera Operator Demonstrates The Eye-Popping Ability Of 'The World's Most Advanced Camera Stabilizer'
item.description: "It's almost like you have a third arm coming out the side of your hip."

item.title: Gem Fatale: The Frenzied Hustle Of The Jewelry Business
item.description: "All small-time hustlers living beyond their means are gamblers."

item.title: Everything I Thought While Rewatching 'He's Just Not That Into You'
item.description: Scarlett Johansson, Jennifer Aniston, Bradley Cooper, Ben Affleck and a host of other stars appear in this 2009 romantic comedy, which we're revisiting on Netflix.
item.kicker: WE MIGHT NOT STILL BE INTO IT

item.title: I Edited The Buttholes Out Of 'Cats.' It Was A Total Nightmare
item.description: A source gave us the scoop about the Universal bomb's elusive "butthole cut" — and how an allegedly tyrannical Tom Hooper made the production "almost slavery" for its VFX crew.

item.title: What Is The Best 'Movie Song' Of All Time?
item.description: From "Edelweiss" to "Whoop That Trick," we're paying homage to the most memorable songs ever created—and performed—in a film.

item.title: An Explosives Engineer And Special-Effects Supervisor Review Famous On-Camera Explosions
item.description: Professor Paul Worsey and special effects supervisor Tassilo Baur sit down to review scenes from "Mission Impossible," "Drive Angry," "The Hurt Locker" and "No Country for Old Men."
item.kicker: 'WHAT REALLY MAKES THIS SCENE IS NICOLAS CAGE'

item.title: Chris Evans Doesn't Like To Talk About Himself. But He Did. Sort Of
item.description: The actor formerly known as Cap has earned career freedom. But first, he just wants to hang out with his dog, Dodger.

item.title: Missing 'The New Mutants'? Try These Five Movies
item.description: Wanted to watch X-Men's "The New Mutants" this weekend? Unfortunately you can't, but if you want to hit the same spot, here are five great movies that are like "New Mutants."

item.title: Is Quibi A Good Idea?
item.description: Two television writers debate whether or not the soon-to-be-launched short-form, celebrity-led streaming service will find an audience.

item.title: The '80s Blockbuster Era Really Began With 'Return Of The Jedi' And The Millions Of Toys It Sold
item.description: By the time George Lucas made "Return Of The Jedi," his "Star Wars" movies had become, quite possibly, the first sure thing in the history of the moviemaking business.
item.kicker: IF THERE AIN'T MERCH, IT AIN'T MUCH

item.title: I Watched This Meghan Markle Hallmark Film Five Times in Quarantine So You Don't Have To
item.description: Meghan Markle starred in a not-terrible Hallmark Channel film, called "The Dater's Handbook." Vulture recommends watching it while in quarantine.

item.title: The 50 Most Important American Independent Movies
item.description: In our attempt to assemble this list, we have included works by mavericks, film school grads and true outsiders; productions with multimillion-dollar budgets and labors of love; movies that played the arthouse, the grindhouse, or barely anywhere at all.

item.title: Will The Coronavirus Pandemic Wipe Out All Of Summer Blockbuster Season?
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic spells disaster for summer blockbuster season and the industry that depend on it.

item.title: Why 'Shrek' Was So Effective At Subverting Kids Movie Tropes
item.description: An analysis of how "Shrek" was so successful at being an unabashed dunk on the Disney Princess industrial complex.

item.title: 'The Road To El Dorado' Survived Bad Reviews, Financial Failure And Sh*tposting
item.description: The DreamWorks animated movie "The Road to El Dorado," now streaming on Hulu, bombed in 2000, but found a strong internet fandom. Characters like Tulio and Miguel popped up in memes, GIFs, and headcanons across Tumblr and beyond. There's a reason why.

item.title: Anthony Daniels Explains What It Was Like Wearing The C-3PO Costumes
item.description: The "Star Wars" actor describes the arduous process of being suited up for his iconic gold metal costume.

item.title: A Full 2020 Digital Movie Rental Calendar
item.description: Looking for a guide to when you can rent "Little Women," "Rise of Skywalker," "Sonic the Hedgehog" and other new releases? We've got a full 2020 VOD rental calendar for you to mark up.
item.kicker: THIS SHOULD GET US THROUGH THE YEAR

item.title: Someone Recreated A Scene From 'Twilight' With Memojis And We Have So, So Many Questions
item.description: Is… is this real dialogue from the movie?
item.kicker: STILL DEBATING HOW MUCH WE HATE THIS

item.title: Gerard Butler Flees An Extinction-Level Comet Strike In The Trailer For 'Greenland'
item.description: Poor, tired Gerard Butler — can't he just be in a movie where there isn't a world-ending event or terrorist attack on the president?
